org.apache.flex.swf.types

Class StyleChangeRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.swf.types.ShapeRecord
      • org.apache.flex.swf.types.StyleChangeRecord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICharacterReferrer, IDataType

    public class StyleChangeRecord
extends ShapeRecord
implements ICharacterReferrer
    The style change record is also a non-edge record. It can be used to do the following:
    1. Select a fill or line style for drawing.
    2. Move the current drawing position (without drawing).
    3. Replace the current fill and line style arrays with a new set of styles.

    Because fill and line styles often change at the start of a new path, it is useful to perform more than one action in a single record. For example, say a DefineShape tag defines a red circle and a blue square. After the circle is closed, it is necessary to move the drawing position, and replace the red fill with the blue fill. The style change record can achieve this with a single shape record.

      • setDefinedStyles

        public void setDefinedStyles(IFillStyle fillStyle0,
                    IFillStyle fillStyle1,
                    ILineStyle lineStyle,
                    Styles styleContext)
        Select styles from parent ShapeWithStyle record. The FillStyle and LineStyle objects provided must be defined in the parent ShapeWithStyle record. Otherwise, exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        fillStyle0 - fill0 style
        fillStyle1 - fill1 style
        lineStyle - line style
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - using styles not defined in the parent shape

        public void defaultStyles(boolean fill0,
                 boolean fill1,

        clears the styles of this style change record if the respective boolean is set
        Parameters:

        fill1 - true to clear file style 1
        line - true to clear line style
